trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Bime | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Bime | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Bime with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Bime with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Bime.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Bime.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Bime tenant
trans-unit.target: A Bime tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Bime will be able to single sign into the application at your Bime company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Bime will be able to single sign into the application at your Bime company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Bime
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Bime

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Bime.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Bime.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Bime.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Bime.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Bime, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Bime, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Bime</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Bime</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Bime with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Bime with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for Bime requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for Bime requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Bime application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Bime application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Bime page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Bime page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Bime Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.Bimeapp.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Bime Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.Bimeapp.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Bime page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\Bime.cer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Bime page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\Bime.cer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Bime company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Bime company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar, click Admin, and then Account.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar, click Admin, and then Account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the account configuration page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the account configuration page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Enable SAML authentication.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable SAML authentication.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Bime dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Remote Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Bime dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Remote Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Certificate Fingerprint textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Certificate Fingerprint textbox.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Bime, they must be provisioned into Bime.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Bime, they must be provisioned into Bime.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Bime, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Bime, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Bime tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Bime tenant.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar, click Admin, and then Users.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar, click Admin, and then Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Users List, click Add New User (“+”).
trans-unit.target: In the Users List, click Add New User (“+”).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the User Details dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the User Details dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>User Details</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>User Details</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter the First Name, Last Name, Login, Email of a valid AAD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: Enter the First Name, Last Name, Login, Email of a valid AAD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Bime user account creation tools or APIs provided by Bime to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Bime user account creation tools or APIs provided by Bime to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Bime **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Bime **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
